intro: [WRONG START] Astilea forbesii, commonly known as the coastal astelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, spike-like inflorescences bearing small, white or pale blue flowers. It is adapted to coastal environments and is often found growing on rocky shores or sandy beaches. Astelia forbesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh, maritime conditions.
